name: Melia Orlando Suite Hotel at Celebration

reviews.title: Nice hotel, good location!
reviews.text: We are Florida residents & frequent the Disney Parks. This was our first time @ Melia. We were there for a three nights. It was myself, husband, son, daughter-in-law & grandchildren ages 6,3 & infant. We had a 2 bedroom /2 bath family suite, which has 2 double beds in one bedroom, a king size bed in the other bedroom with an attached bath, sofa bed in the living room. It had a kitchen with a full size fridge, microwave & dishwasher. We were on the 5th floor corner suite so it had 2 balconies. The master bedroom balcony was large with a table & 4 chairs & lounge sofa. Everything was clean in the suite. Amenities like shampoo, gel, conditioner were given daily. soap very small bars. The air conditioner handler was in the dining/ living room area was quite noisy, the bedrooms were very warm while you were sleeping. I told the front desk person, Kenneth that ceiling fans were needed for the bedrooms. I found the staff to be very friendly & helpful. We checked in about 9pm & Thomas was very helpful in bringing the luggage, getting the pack-n-play & ice for our suite. I wanted pool view which this suite was not. Kenneth said upon checking in that he would need management to approve this but having the three children I did not want any delay as it was already past their bedtime. As previous reviews stated the breakfast was ok, could be better. But for us it was fine. They had cereal, bagels, pastries , bananas, oranges, apples, urns of fresh delicious coffee, hot water for teas or hot chocolate, orange & cranberry juices, & milk. Waiters were always clearing the tables. I like having continental breakfast especially with the kids. We had dinner @ the restaurant for Mother's Day eve.The service, Jay, & food were very good. Portions were large for a hotel restaurant. The The lobby & the grounds were well kept & clean.,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: pool area was very nice & the water felt warm. We did not use the pool, as we were @ Typhoon Lagoon & Blizzard Beach.
reviews.title: Large Suite-Contemporary

reviews.text: Cons: No information in room re: amenities in hotel, no restaurant info, no ceiling fans in bedroom, quite warm in bedrooms @ night, so much so that my daughter-in-law decided to sleep in living room on sofa bed with the baby. I called reception to find out where extra pillows were kept & was told none in room but would send some to our room. I asked if sofa was made up with sheets & was told definitely....wrong, no sheets & my daughter-in-law had to call when she was ready to go to sleep. Also one day maid left no washcloths & not enough towels.
reviews.title: Room & pool are AMAZING

reviews.text: The hotel could use a larger sign on the road as it is quite small & tourists unfamiliar with the area might ride right past it.
reviews.title: Fabulous!

reviews.text: We stayed at Melia Orlando from 5/2/13-5/9/13. The suite was large with a contemporary design. Great location- close to all Disney parks, convenience stores, restaurants
reviews.title: Strongly recommend Melia Orlando

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pics on the website looked really great so my husband and I decided to stay here for a night away from the kids.
reviews.title: OK stay- trying too hard to be high class.

reviews.text: When we arrived to check in it was apparent that it was an average hotel that is trying to look modern and high-class. It wasn't dirty or anything, I just noticed things like although there were succulents hanging in glass hangers on the wall which looked very clean and modern, the baseboards were scuffed and in fact there was a painter at my feet touching up while I checked in.
reviews.title: Nice stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once we arrived at our room it was more of the same: dark wood cabinets that didn't shut right; modern-looking bathroom but dark spots on the caulk and grout; also a heavy bleach smell was left from the housekeeping. Again, not dirty, it just looked like they were trying too hard.
reviews.title: wonderfull stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best parts of the stay were the pool and the bed. The pool area has got to be the pride and joy of this facility. It was very relaxing, there was music playing but it was soft enough that you could still have a conversation. There were plenty of chairs so you didn't have to sit right next to someone and there were also a ping pong table and foozeball if you didn't want to swim.
reviews.title: Great resort other than problems at check out

reviews.text: The bed was very comfortable which was a pleasant surprise to us. The sheets and mattress cover were very soft and cushiony (if that's a word).
reviews.title: Great Suite Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stopped for two nights, the 28th/29th March of this year. Prior to travelling, I received an e mail about our flights being changed. I e mailed the hotel to advise of this and to say we would not arrive until midnight(ish) local time and the hotel responded to say they would make sure our room was still available regardless. That was great. We arrived, after being awake for more than 24 hours. Immediately impressed by the quality and cleanliness of the room, we crashed out and was looking forward to something for breakfast. We woke, went for breakfast at 9am to find nowhere to seat. On the way to the restaurant we passed people walking back to their rooms carrying coffees and croissants. I thought that was just their preference.
reviews.title: Breakfast issue??

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arriving at the restaurant it was absolutely full with nowhere to seat. I asked the first waitress that I saw about this, and she said that there was seating available upstairs, but because those clients are paying for breakfast the management would not let "customers on complimentary breakfasts go upstairs"
reviews.title: Great Service/ Good Value; why stay at a Disney resort?

reviews.text: I could understand under normal circumstances, but when the downstairs and outside seating areas are full, what are you supposed to do.
reviews.title: Thanks for making our reunion so special!

reviews.text: The answer was to go out and get breakfast elsewhere, which we did. The second morning, we did not even bother to try the breakfast buffet, just went out again.
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay

reviews.text: We are travelling back to Orlando again in August and are looking to stop somewhere for 3 nights.
reviews.title: I agree with jane J

reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel 31st March 2013 for 1 week, we found the room very clean and spacious for the 3 of us, we were located on the ground and anticipated this being noisy as it looked onto the pool, but how wrong was i, very well built and noise levels very good.
reviews.title: Spot On

reviews.text: The rooms come very well equipped and plenty of storage space. we had read some comments about staff being not so helpful, but we had not found that at all and all were friendly and accommodating.
reviews.title: I strongly recommend this hotel!

reviews.text: We have been to Florida many times and this is probably on my top 3 places to stay, purely due to my previous comments and location, Celebration for us is one of the nicest places to be, everything is close and convenient.
reviews.title: Girls Get-a-Way

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed for 10 nights at the Melia, which might give you some idea of how much we loved this hotel! I was having surgery at incredible Florida Hospital, a short distance away, so the location was perfect. We had two large bedrooms, plus a full kitchen, which assured us that we didn't have to go out for dinner, but if we did go out, there were dozens of eating places within a few miles, plus a large supermarket. The rooms were bright and airy, with a balcony and wonderful view of the swimming pool, which was the most "kid friendly" I have ever seen! Because of the shallow depth in some places, even toddlers could be taken there! Awesome service (esp. from Kevin!). I would strongly recommend this hotel for families, or for anyone, for that matter. We will definitely be staying at the Melia again when we return in a few months!
reviews.title: Great experience!

reviews.text: I would highly recommend the Melia - it was very clean, very accessible to many attractions, easy to find, the service was excellent, and the restaurant was great! We had a few small issues, but when brought to the attention of the front desk, they were taken care of right away. The staff was very accommodating ... the beds were extremely comfortable, and the room was spacious. Downside - the room keys were not reliable for the first couple of days and we had to ask for washcloths every day (very strange), and the "free" breakfast left a bit to be desired - we ate in the restaurant for breakfast - even though we had to pay for it, it was well worth the price. Other than that, we were very happy with the trip. We stayed for nine nights - happy to do so again!
reviews.title: Fantastic Service!!
